Html:
Hi, I'm using the Modularity with MEF QuickStart Sample for Silverlight...

I'm getting the next error when I try to load the module B (WhenAvailable) in OOB Mode from a https URI (https://localhost/ModularityWithMef.Silverlight.Web) locally

[Debug][Low] 'ModuleB' module loaded.[Debug][Low] 'ModuleB' module loaded.[Exception][High] Failed to load type for module ModuleB. 
If this error occurred when using MEF in a Silverlight application, please ensure that the CopyLocal property of the reference to the MefExtensions assembly is set to true in the main application/shell and false in all other assemblies. 
Error was: The remote server returned an error: NotFound..

When I load the app inside the browser I don't get any error, only happens in OOB Mode

Is there a workaround?

Hi,

You might find the following thread useful, as a similar issue is described there:

Intermittent NotFound error with Prism Modules +MEF when running Silverlight out of browser

Aside from that, does the error ocur if you load the module from an HTTP source? If that is the case, you could check whether your certificates are correct and up-to-date.

I hope you find this helpful.

Guido Leandro Maliandi
http://blogs.southworks.net/gmaliandi
